quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: President and U.s.
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, people, presidents. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which explorer realized the first known successful attempt to circumnavigate the Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ferdinand Magellan

questions.question: Which President said Speak softly and carry a big stick.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Theodor Teddy Roosevelt

questions.question: What U.S. President used the words When in the course of human events?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Jefferson

questions.question: Name the Portuguese explorer who was in command of the first ships to sail directly from Europe to India.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vasco da Gama

questions.question: This Italian explored the east coast of South America much further south than any other European before and realized that this land was part of a new continent while many other European explorers crossing the Atlantic thought they were reaching Asia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Amerigo Vespucci

questions.question: Which U.S. President is considered the father of the Constitution?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Madison

questions.question: Which U.S. political party is also known as the GOP?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Republican

questions.question: Which two U.S. Presidents died on the same day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Adams and Thomas Jefferson

questions.question: Which Spanish explorer was the first recorded European to reach the Mississippi River?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hernando de Soto

questions.question: While this President was skinny dipping in the Potomac River a female journalist took his clothes and refused to give them to him until he gave an interview.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Quincy Adams

questions.question: Who was President of the United States when the atomic bombs were dropped in August 1945?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry S. Truman

questions.question: Who was the first U.S. President born in a hospital?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimmy Carter

questions.question: Who was the first President to serve two nonconsecutive terms in office?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grover Cleavland

questions.question: Who was the twenty-third President of the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Benjamin Harrison

questions.question: Christopher Columbus, one of the most successful explorers in the European Age of Discovery and among the first Europeans to explore the Americas (after the Vikings,) was of what nationality?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Italian

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Lady and Explorer
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, college, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Beatrix, Queen of the Netherlands, acceded to the throne after the abdication of which monarch?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Queen Juliana

questions.question: Who was the first First Lady to receive a college degree?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lucy Webb Hayes

questions.question: This first lady was responsible for the Cherry Blossoms we can enjoy every spring.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Helen Taft

questions.question: She received many honorary degrees before becoming First Lady.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lou Hoover

questions.question: Which of these First Ladies had a law degree?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hillary Clinton

questions.question: Name the French navigator and explorer who was the first to describe and map Canada.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jacques Cartier

questions.question: Which Spanish explorer conquered the Inca Empire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Francisco Pizarro

questions.question: This explorer was one of the first Europeans to travel the Silk Road and meet the Great Khan of the Mongol Empire, Kublai Khan.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marco Polo

questions.question: Born in Utrecht, on April 27th, 1967 and known as the Prince of Orange, he is the eldest son of Queen Beatrix of the Netherlands.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Willem-Alexander

questions.question: While in the White House this First Lady suffered from epileptic seizures.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ida Saxton McKinley

questions.question: Which First Lady rescued the portrait of George Washington when the British burned the city during the war of 1812?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dolley Madison

questions.question: This First Ladys husband suffered a stroke in 1919 and she assumed his responsibilities and made decisions for him the last year and a half of his term of office.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edith Wilson

questions.question: Which First Lady did not see her husband die during his term of office?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nancy Reagan

questions.question: Mary Todd Lincoln was committed to a mental institution.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This First Lady banned cards and alcohol while living at the White House.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sarah Childress Polk

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Netherlands and Queen Beatrix
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, people, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Dutch royal family has been historically associated with what color?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Orange

questions.question: In what year did Queen Beatrix of the Netherlands ascend the throne?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1980

questions.question: This Dutch monarch held the title Queen Mother from 1980 until her death in 2004.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Juliana

questions.question: What name is Mexican revolutionary Doroteo Arango better know as?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pancho Villa

questions.question: According to the Hebrew Bible, who was Moses father-in-law?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jethro

questions.question: Beatrix, Queen of the Netherlands, was born in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1938

questions.question: From what country was the first astronaut who was not Russian or American?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Czechoslovakia

questions.question: Queen Juliana of the Netherlands gave birth to how many daughters?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Four

questions.question: From which university did Queen Beatrix of the Netherlands obtain her degree in law in practice?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leiden

questions.question: Queen Beatrix of the Netherlands gave birth to how many sons?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Three

questions.question: This German-born nobleman is the late father of Queen Beatrix of the Netherlands.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prince Bernhard

questions.question: In 1877, Spencer Gore was the first winner of what tournament?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wimbledon

questions.question: This Argentine lady married Prince Willem-Alexander of the Netherlands on February 2, 2002.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Princess Maxima

questions.question: What fictional character was James Bond first married to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Teresa Tracy Draco

questions.question: This German diplomat, who died on October 6, 2002 was the spouse of Queen Beatrix of the Netherlands.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prince Claus

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Dog and Life
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, leader, vocalist. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The poison which philosopher Socrates was sentenced to drinking contained this poisonous plant.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hemlock

questions.question: How did Judas Iscariot choose to end his life according to the Gospel of Matthew?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He hanged himself.

questions.question: What were the names of the lovers in the musical West Side Story?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Toni and Maria

questions.question: Who called the police on August 5, 1962 to report that Marilyn Monroe was dead?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Her psychiatrist, Dr. Ralph Greenson

questions.question: Sigmund Freud was suffering from this type of cancer, which caused him to commit a suicide with the assistance of his doctor.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oral cancer

questions.question: How did Nirvana vocalist Kurt Cobain end his life on April 5, 1994?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He shot himself.

questions.question: What politician was nicknamed Il Duce?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Benito Mussolini

questions.question: A line in this lawyers summation to the jury has become a part of pop culture.  Who said If the glove doesnt fit, you must acquit.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnnie Cochran

questions.question: What Shakespeare character said The quality of mercy is not strained. It droppeth as the gentle rain from heaven?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Portia

questions.question: What was one of the reasons for Roman politician and General Mark Antonys suicide on August 1, 30 BC?

options.text: He thought Queen Cleopatra had already committed suicide herself.
He believed Queen Cleopatra was cheating on him.
He killed Queen Cleopatra before that.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He thought Queen Cleopatra had already committed suicide herself.

questions.question: This lawyer, who graduated from Stanford Law School and served on the Arizona Court of Appeals, was appointed by President Ronald Reagan as the first woman to serve on the United States Supreme Court.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sandra Day OConnor

questions.question: This flamboyant criminal lawyer said: Say you sue me because you say my dog bit you. Well, now this is my defense: My dog doesnt bite. And second, my dog was tied up that night. And third, I dont believe you were bit. And fourth, I dont have a dog. This lawyer represented T. Cullen Davis, one of the wealthiest men to ever stand trial for murder in the United States. He won two acquittals for Davis for the murder of  twelve-year-old Andrea Wilborn and the attempted murder of Judge Joe Eidson.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Racehorse Haynes

questions.question: How did German Nazi leader Adolf Hitler take his own life, according to a prevailing theory?

options.text: He injected poison in his veins.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He shot himself.

questions.question: Name the three musketeers in Alexandre Dumass novel by the same name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Athos, Portos, Aramis

questions.question: Who was the inventor of dynamite?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alfred Nobel

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: People and Person
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, actor, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: These people have highly sensible noses and their task is to ensure that a NASA flight wont be aborted due to bad smells in space.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Master Sniffers

questions.question: What was the reason for actor George Reeves suicide according to the police report?

options.text: He knew he was very sick with no chance of recovery.
He couldnt get the sort of parts he wanted.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He couldnt get the sort of parts he wanted.

questions.question: These people, who get active when it is dark, walk around gardens, parks, lawns to gather earthworms and sell them for fish bait.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Worm pickers

questions.question: How did Roman Emperor Nero kill himself?

options.text: He let a lion kill him.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He cut his throat.

questions.question: This person takes care of the hair and makeup of dead people.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Funeral Parlor Cosmetologist

questions.question: What is the name of the last novel written by author Virginia Woolf before she took her own life?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Between the Acts

questions.question: This profession is related to making food look fresh and delicious on photographs and advertisements.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Food Stylist

questions.question: This job requires sorting lasts(shoe molds) in numbered racks and transporting them to a storage room.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Last putter-away

questions.question: This person runs into the water in search of the balls that the golf players strike inaccurately.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Golf Ball Diver

questions.question: This job requires dipping nuts in hot water, so their shells get softer, as well as maintaining the equipment and temperature.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nut steamer

questions.question: George Washington lived in the White House.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: These people are most likely to be met in the labs of mouthwash companies, where they indulge in the smell of different breaths in order to test the products.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Odor Judges

questions.question: This job involves taking care of all the certificates and registration issues of race horses, examining the horses and their identification marks and reporting the possible unconformities.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Horse Identifier

questions.question: Where was the first president of the United States of America, George Washington, buried?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mount Vernon

questions.question: This person works with machines used to coat popcorn or other products with melted cheese.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cheese Sprayer

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: President and Country
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, john, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This politician, who became Israels first female Prime Minister, used to be called the best man in the government.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Golda Meir

questions.question: What do Indira Ghandi and Benazir Bhuto have in common?

options.text: They were the first female Prime Ministers of their countries.
They were Prime Ministers of Asian countries.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: During her tenure as the first female Prime Minister of the UK, this Iron Lady reduced the power of trade unions, survived an assassination attempt, and staunchly opposed communism.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Margaret Thatcher

questions.question: Which US presidents face is on the 20 dollar bill?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andrew Jackson

questions.question: This suffragist is considered the first woman to run for President of the United States although her name was not printed on the ballot.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Victoria Woodhull

questions.question: What was George Washingtons party?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: none

questions.question: What happened to the White House when James Madison, the fourth president, was in office?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: was set on fire

questions.question: Who was the first vice president to succeed a president who had died before his term was over?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Tyler

questions.question: When John Tyler became president, he did something that angered US citizens. What was it?

options.text: vetoed the Bank of the United States
set his rivals house on fire
passed a law saying that no citizens could bear arms

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: vetoed the Bank of the United States

questions.question: Martin Van Buren served 1 term as president.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Angela Merkel, a trained scientist, is the first woman to become Chancellor of this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Germany

questions.question: How many different presidential parties were there up to John Tyler?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4

questions.question: Madeleine Albright, the first woman to become United States Secretary of State, was born Marie Jana Korbelová in this European country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Czechoslovakia

questions.question: A self-proclaimed plain housewife, this lady was the first President of an Asian country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Corazon Aquino

questions.question: What female politician is not correctly matched with the country of which she was Prime Minister?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eva Peron - Argentina
